laboratory_examinations.findings: Did not increase the serum testosterone concentration.
Showed no abnormalities in the brain, including the hypothalamus and pituitary gland.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Sequence analysis of the CHD7 gene
laboratory_examinations.findings: Revealed an 8-nucleotide deletion in exon 4 (c.2099_2106delAATAAGAA) of CHD7.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Histological examination of the excised testes
laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed atrophic seminiferous tubules with only Sertoli cells apparent. Germ cells were large and atypical with nuclear atypia and clear cytoplasm.
Weak positivity for CD117 and SALL4, indicating maturation arrest of spermatogenesis and germ cell neoplasia in situ (GCNIS) in bilateral testes.
Negative for P450scc, P45017α, 3β-HSD, and 17β-HSD; positive for Ad4BP/SF-1, suggesting impaired testosterone synthesis at the enzymatic level, not at the transcriptional level.
